description: A country with infinite amount of things to do! Go surfing in Bali, whiteboard rafting in the forest, go up sulfur mountain in Java, and climb above the clouds at Mt.Agung to kickstart your journey!
tips: Get a private driver/guide to get the most out of the experience if you cannot speak the language
Get Immodium in case of Bali belly
Flies in restaurants are normal

description: Cheap food, elephant sightings, and beautiful islands - what's not to like? Spend a day at the elephant conservatory in ChangMai and take a boat to Phi Phi for their amazing night scene and firedancers
food: Pad Thai - tastes best from street vendors
tips: Avoid companies that offer elephant rides/tours - elephants undergo abusive treatment. Spend a day at an elephant conservatory instead and support their rescue missions!
Best foods are from the night market and street vendors

description: Spent two months there and was blessed by their daily night markets. Hit up night markets in Kaoshiung where selection of great foods are seemingly endless. Love Spirited Away? Go to Jiufen, the place that inspired the set! For nature views, go to Sun Moon Lake in Yuchi and ride a gondulon down its mountains.
tips: Be prepared for super hot and humid weather
The Taiwanese are the nicest people you will ever meet
Climb alongside monkeys at monkey mountain for your first hike

description: The cultural melting pot of Asia - where you can find a mix of asian culture and food from all over. Start your day by feasting in food markets, visiting their art museums or hitting up Santosa island for Universal Studios, and finish it all off by going to Clarke Quay for its incredible night scene!
food: Song Fa Bak Kut Teh - famous for pork bone soup
Boon Tong Kee - hainan chicken w/ rice & coconut water
tips: Visit the Old Airport Road food market for an amazing (and cheap) selection of local food
They have really good abstract art museums - esp Red Dot Museum and SAM

description: Amsterdam, the port city of The Netherlands, is the place to visit when in Europe. Check out their Albert Kuyp food market and the vibrate nightlife at the Red Light District. Tired of the city? Hop on a bike and ride over to Broek in Waterland to unwind.
tips: Admission fees for their big museums are pretty high (esp the Van Gogh Museum)
Most things in general are pricy in Amsterdam except stuff at local markets

description: Basically a European version of Toronto. If you're a lover of meat, go to the central food market in Krakow for the largest sausages you'll ever see!
tips: More stuff to do at night
Would not really recommend their traditional food

description: Home of the best chocolates in the world and full of natural beauty. It is a place where you will immediately feel at peace, a place where you find as many swans in rivers as segulls.
food: Swiss Chocolate - even their Ferrero Raffaello are miles better
Hot chocolate at a local chocolatier in St.Gallen - guaranteed to be the best hot chocolate you will ever have
tips: Zurich is incredibly expensive - at least 50 cad for a light meal; eat in St.Gallen instead
Can literally hit up the convenience store for good chocolate
StartHacks refund most of your flights - attend if you have time

description: As you step off the plane, you are transported into another planet. A place where people still believe in mythical trolls, elves, and hidden people. Beautiful glaciers, mountains, and lakes will immediately catch your eye. Take a trip to Blue Lagoon near Reykjavik for the most incredible hot spring and finish off with an excursion to see the northern lights.
food: Messinn - All you can eat fish buffet
tips: Food and living expenses are incredibly expensive
Going on a tour to see the northern lights is like taking a gamble - very rarely you will see it
Better to travel Iceland by renting a car

description: Italy is the best country to visit in Europe - every city is so different from another. Florence is easily one of the most beautiful cities in all of Europe. Venice is a city where the roads are replaced with rivers and bridges act as crossings. Naples has the best pizzas in the world - worth going just for pizza at Lombardi and Da Michele.
food: Lombardi, Da Michele (Michelin star) - Margherita Pizza
tips: All pizzas in Italy tastes horrible compared to the ones from Naples (where Pizza originated from)
The subway system is a mess - trains are always late and platforms are posted 5-10 minutes before they leave
Bus schedules are not followed
Rome is good to go to if you have an appreciation of Roman history.

description: Visit the medival town in Carcassonne and be transported into the set of Game of Thrones (as we imagine it)!
tips: They eat a lot of international food so it can be pretty hard to find traditional dishes
They also operate by Spanish time so be prepared to wait until late for places to serve food

description: Japan is unlike any other country on Earth. Tokyo is the best food city, holding the world record for the most michelin star restaurants. You can basically plan your entire trip around food while exploring the natural beauty of Japan.
tips: The malls with the best food floors in Ginza are Matsuya and Mitsukoshi
Get a Suica card for the metro
Japanese food is good no matter where you go - they just have higher food standards overall
Best way to eat ramen is to sip something sweet every 3-4 bites to enhance the flavor - B

description: Spain is simply beautiful. Unlike Morocco, the gems lie within its architecture. Bike around Barcelona, you will be pleasantly surprised by what you find. Visit the heart of Spain in Seville and the city of arts and sciences in Valencia to be blown away by its intricate design. Love to golf or want to learn? Head down to Palma for the best golf courses!
food: KingDo LITE (Seville) - Best Asian food I have tried anywhere. The chef combines the best european culinary techniques with asian food
tips: Alcohol is super cheap
Spainish shops are closed between 4pm-7pm
Beware of theives and pickpocketers
Barcelona is the city of dogs
Visit spain during the off seasons otherwise it will be flooded with tourists
KingDo is a chain; go to KingDo LITE

description: Go to Lisbon and feast on Portugese egg tarts! You can basically walk along the central area and find tons to do. Be sure to visit the Timeout food market and head to the tower in city center for a panaramic view of this beautiful place!
food: Fried apple pie at McDonalds (so good)
tips: Do not take taxis - they even try to scam locals for 3-4 times the price
Uber everywhere

description: Greece is a country of contrast - Athens and Thessaloniki leave a lot to be desired but climb to the Monasteries in Meteroa and step into heaven itself. Had a few days to spare? Go island hopping off the coast of Greece!
tips: If you go to Athens, try to stay around the city center

description: The natural beauty of Africa is unparalleled to any other place on Earth. This is a place that you need at least 5 days to do. Take a camel ride through the Sahara from morning till night to catch the sunrise or gaze at the beautiful night sky.
tips: Best to book a private guide/driver for a desert tour - easy to get scammed if you are not a local
Do research - prepare for common scams
Message me if you need to find a guide/driver :)
Learn to haggle

description: Get ready to witness the highest concentration of chocolatier stores in central Brussles. Go to the square and check out their architecture.
tips: Their chocolates have a higher cocoa content than normal - would recommend swiss chocolates instead if you like milk chocolate more

description: One of the most multicultural and cold countries you can go to. If you come during winter, you can visit Mont.Tremblant in Montreal to ski/snowboard.
tips: Be prepared for extremely cold winters
